alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 2:51AM CDT until May 26 at 12:42PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County. For the Whitewater River...including Towanda, Augusta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Whitewater River at Towanda. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flooding over cropland becomes more widespread. County roads flood at Southwest 40th Street on low spots near the river about 2 miles downstream of gage and along Southwest 60th Street just west of Fulton Road near the river located 4 miles south of Towanda. Further downstream, 5 miles south of Towanda, expect flooding across Southwest 70th., * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 2.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 24.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Whitewater River Towanda 22.0 2.0 Tue 2 am CDT 18.3 21.9 11.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
